subject: Re: [junit] black box or white box?
msgSnippet: ... Hm. I see Black Box Testing as some kind of behaviour testing, I test the interface and automated interface tests make sure my whole software works after I
messageBody:
On Friday 03 May 2002 06:15, Berin Loritsch wrote:

> JUnit is designed for blackbox testing. That is how it should be
> used. The new JDK 1.4 assertion facilities are for whitebox testing.
> That is how they should be used.

Hm.
I see Black Box Testing as some kind of behaviour testing, I test the
interface and automated interface tests make sure my whole software
works after I changed one class. Maybe a little integration testing
here.

But I disagree that JUnit is not white box testing.
IMHO JUnit's main advantage is automated testing, wether black, white,
any other color, integration, or regression testing. Black box testing
does not suffice, some useful tests may come to mind only after looking
at the source code.

Robert
